almakkiyah.name: Al-Makkiyah
almakkiyah.desc:
Al-Makkiyah is a website selling skincare products from one of our clients located in Kediri, East Java, Indonesia. In this website there are some features like the existing sales website, but the difference on this website is the existence of a member affiliate system that allows customers to become affiliates and earn additional income by buying and distributing certain products in the hope of increasing the number of permanent customers on al-makkiyah.com.

     Al-Makkiyah is an enterprise user of Merchant.id that allows al-makkiyah to use all the features of the dashboard that Merchant.id has. One of the most important of them is omni.merchant.id. Al-Makkiyah manages all the orders that have been obtained from al-makkiyah.com through omni.merchant.id. In the creation of al-makkiyah.com we spent about 3 months starting from the initial configuration until finally al-makkikiyah.com began to operate fully. al-makkiyah.com was built with the tech stack Svelte Framework, jQuery, Native CSS + Bootstrap v4.6, and Custom PHP Laravel Frameworks.

     In the development process of al-makkiyah.com, I was assisted by a colleague at PT. Codelaris Inti Sinergi. During the development process I worked more with the UI/UX and Backend Developer team. From the beginning of the creation of al-makkiyah.com, the UI/UX team prepared design mockups in Figma. After the mockup is done for all pages, at that point I began to do slicing design from Figma to Svelte. And that's how the process of crafting continues until page by page is complete and correctly in accordance with the initial planning of construction. Not to forget that after the entire website was successfully built, the Tester team tested al-makkiyah.com. If at the time of testing a bug has been detected, then the bug will be immediately reported to the developer team for immediate correction and so on until the testing process does not find a bug at all.

     The hardest challenge in making al-makkiyah.com was when I was already processing the data integration of the Backend Developer team, where sometimes there was an impediment on the API that had been made by Backend Developers which resulted in me having to wait for the backend developer team in the process of revision of the impediment until the mentioned impediment was properly overcome.

So yeah, that's the process in the making of almakkiyah.com
